fr:mainmatter.fr:p: There is a common pattern in all of the above research: one identifies a topology \tau on the objects of interest X (usually it is a metric space), then defines partial approximants of the objects out of the resources available in the space (usually these are certain compact or closed sets) and a partial order P between them. The construction makes the modelled space homeomorphic to the subset of maximal elements of P in the subspace of the Scott topology: (X, \tau ) \simeq ( \mathsf {max}( P ) , \sigma |_{ \mathsf {max}( P ) }).
